page.title: 04LITTLE DEWCHURCH / BOLSTONE
page.content: This is mainly a{farming area,}with {Little Dewchurch}as{the only village in it. The{farms}are fairly {scattered,}and have a mixture of {cattle, sheep and crops. }The countryside is quite pretty, with {little valleys}and some{very narrow {winding roads}with high banks beside them. The hedges are very neat. A lot of houses sell things to passers by, such as{Christmas trees, fruit, {vegetables and eggs. }Some of the more remote houses and farms have old cars and pieces of farm equipment rusting in the fields. The{people}in the countryside seem very{different}to town people - they are more{self- {sufficient and suspicious of {strangers. }Little Dewchurch is not very pretty. It only has one{public {telephone,}and most of the glass in it was broken. {The people were nice.
